original_solution_mapping.L2: The cucumbers allow him to make 60 pickles because 10 x 6 = <<10*6=60>>60
original_solution_mapping.L3: The vinegar allows him to make 10 jars of pickles because 100 / 10 = <<100/10=10>>10
original_solution_mapping.L4: The vinegar is enough to make 60 pickles because 10 x 6 = <<10*6=60>>60

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7316.
    Returns: the remaining ounces of vinegar.
    """
    # L1
    num_jars = 4 # 4 jars
    pickles_per_jar = 12 # Each jar can hold 12 pickles
    pickles_from_jars = num_jars * pickles_per_jar

    # L2
    num_cucumbers = 10 # 10 cucumbers
    pickles_per_cucumber = 6 # Each cucumber makes six pickles
    pickles_from_cucumbers = num_cucumbers * pickles_per_cucumber

    # L3
    total_vinegar_oz = 100 # 100 oz of vinegar
    vinegar_per_jar = 10 # 10 ounces of vinegar per jar
    jars_from_vinegar = total_vinegar_oz / vinegar_per_jar

    # L4
    pickles_from_vinegar = jars_from_vinegar * pickles_per_cucumber

    # L5
    # The solution implies that pickles_from_jars is the limiting factor.
    max_pickles_can_make = pickles_from_jars

    # L6
    jars_needed = max_pickles_can_make / pickles_per_jar

    # L7
    vinegar_needed = jars_needed * vinegar_per_jar

    # L8
    vinegar_remaining = total_vinegar_oz - vinegar_needed

    # FA
    answer = vinegar_remaining
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: The jars allow him to make {pickles_from_jars} pickles because {num_jars} x {pickles_per_jar} = <<{num_jars}*{pickles_per_jar}={pickles_from_jars}>>{pickles_from_jars}

The cucumbers allow him to make {pickles_from_cucumbers} pickles because {num_cucumbers} x {pickles_per_cucumber} = <<{num_cucumbers}*{pickles_per_cucumber}={pickles_from_cucumbers}>>{pickles_from_cucumbers}
The vinegar allows him to make {jars_from_vinegar} jars of pickles because {total_vinegar_oz} / {vinegar_per_jar} = <<{total_vinegar_oz}/{vinegar_per_jar}={jars_from_vinegar}>>{jars_from_vinegar}

The vinegar is enough to make {pickles_from_vinegar} pickles because {jars_from_vinegar} x {pickles_per_cucumber} = <<{jars_from_vinegar}*{pickles_per_cucumber}={pickles_from_vinegar}>>{pickles_from_vinegar}
He needs {jars_needed} jars to make this because {max_pickles_can_make} / {pickles_per_jar} = <<{max_pickles_can_make}/{pickles_per_jar}={jars_needed}>>{jars_needed}
He needs {vinegar_needed} ounces of vinegar because {jars_needed} x {vinegar_per_jar} = <<{jars_needed}*{vinegar_per_jar}={vinegar_needed}>>{vinegar_needed}

explanation: Incorrect final answer. An intermediate value 'vinegar_needed' (value: 40.0) was reported instead of 'vinegar_remaining' (value: 60.0).
